quest.name: All Things in Time
journal:
* This quest has been adjusted. Please abandon the quest and restart it by speaking to F'lhaminn in Wineport.

※The Main Scenario Guide shows the next available quest. You can toggle it on and off in Character Configuration, under UI Settings.

Gazing upon the foul-smelling pugil carcasses is enough to deprive you of any lingering appetite. You can only hope that the gurangatch will regard them more favorably. Place the bait at the water's edge in gurangatch territory and find out if your quarry's tastes truly are so different from your own.
The trap now set, you can but wait and hope. Retreat to a safe distance and bide your time.

As if to confirm the fundamental differences between the palates of your respective species, the pugil carcasses prove irresistible to a truly gigantic gurangatch, which you duly slay. While you set about the nauseating task of scraping the creature's belly oil into a flask, you ponder what manner of individual first thought to use the secretions in a perfume... Push such irrelevant musings aside and deliver the fetid fruits of your labors to F'lhaminn in Wineport.

F'lhaminn requires only a brief moment to finish her perfume. Her preparations complete, she agrees to accompany you and Alphinaud to Vesper Bay. Return to the Waking Sands and seek an audience with Minfilia.

Upon seeing Alphinaud escort F'lhaminn into the solar, Minfilia rushes forward to embrace her long-lost mother, overjoyed to learn that reports of her death were indeed exaggerated. During their tearful reunion, Minfilia explains that her father was once a member of the Ala Mhigan Resistance, and that following his death in a tragic accident, F'lhaminn raised her as her own. After praising Minfilia for her victories over the Empire, F'lhaminn states that the Scions must leave Ul'dah behind if they are to continue their work. Agreeing at last to Alphinaud's proposal, a reinvigorated Minfilia declares that the order will quit Vesper Bay and establish a new headquarters in Revenant's Toll.

dialogue.name: FLHAMINN
dialogue.text: Believe me when I tell you that I am every bit as eager to return to Vesper Bay as you are. There is work to be done ere that, however, so listen well.

dialogue.name: FLHAMINN
dialogue.text: I require pristine salamander oil to complete my perfume.

dialogue.name: FLHAMINN
dialogue.text: Oil this pure can only be obtained from the belly of a gurangatch, a notoriously elusive species of wavekin native to Bronze Lake.

dialogue.name: FLHAMINN
dialogue.text: Elusive, I say, yet no less sensible to the allure of the right bait. In this instance, that would be freshly slain mud pugils. Three placed at the water's edge should be sufficient to tempt any gurangatch lurking nearby.

dialogue.name: FLHAMINN
dialogue.text: They are aggressive when startled, and will attack on sight. Yet given the ease with which you dispatched that goobbue, I doubt they will trouble you unduly.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Despite her years of nomadism, it would seem Lady F'lhaminn has kept a close eye on the affairs of our order. Surprisingly close, in fact. Suffice to say, she is nothing if not resourceful.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: One does not develop such skills without effort─or without reason.

dialogue.name: FLHAMINN
dialogue.text: Understand it is of the utmost importance that I finish this perfume before I accompany you to Vesper Bay. Please bring me the oil as soon as possible.

dialogue.name: FLHAMINN
dialogue.text: Once again, I am in your debt.

dialogue.name: FLHAMINN
dialogue.text:
I distilled the flowers' oils in your absence, so all that remains is to...
There. It is ready.

dialogue.name: FLHAMINN
dialogue.text: And so am I. It is time we went to see my daughter.

dialogue.name: FLHAMINN
dialogue.text: We've no reason to stay here. Why do you delay? I have kept my daughter waiting long enough.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Antecedent─you have a guest.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Lhaminn!?

dialogue.name: FLHAMINN
dialogue.text: Ascilia...

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: (I haven't seen her like this in years, Forename!)

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: I...I never truly believed it when they told me you were dead. But...what kept you away for so long?

dialogue.name: FLHAMINN
dialogue.text: The imperials came for me, as I always knew they would. And so I resolved to stay as far away from you as I could, lest their pursuit of me endanger you and our cause. I could think of no better way to grant you the freedom to continue our work.

dialogue.name: FLHAMINN
dialogue.text: And continue it you did, achieving things I would not have imagined possible. I followed your every success, and celebrated in secret.

dialogue.name: FLHAMINN
dialogue.text: I'm so proud of you, Ascilia.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: I learned from the best.

dialogue.name: FLHAMINN
dialogue.text: I have a gift for you.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Celsettia perfume! You remembered.

dialogue.name: FLHAMINN
dialogue.text: How could I ever forget? You wore it all the time. If ever I lost sight of you, I could find you again, just by following my nose.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: I did not think it was made anymore. You must have gone to so much trouble...

dialogue.name: FLHAMINN
dialogue.text: It was no trouble to me, my darling. I fear I cannot say the same for Forename, however. I could not have made it without herhim.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Thank you, Forename. Thank you both.

dialogue.name: FLHAMINN
dialogue.text: There's something else.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: This...this is the cat's-eye I found! All these years you kept it...

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: My father was a member of the Ala Mhigan Resistance.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: When I was yet a child, he brought me here to Ul'dah. The accident which claimed his life happened shortly after our arrival.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: It was Lhaminn who took care of me then. She raised me as her own─taught me everything I needed to know to survive.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Hmm. I am no stranger to the facts of your history, yet I fear I have failed to grasp their implications. It is clear that there is much I do not know─about you and your mother both.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: One of her first lessons to me concerned mining─and I was a very dedicated student.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: This cat's-eye was the first stone I unearthed. It wasn't much, of course, but I was exceedingly proud to have found it nonetheless.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text:
So I gave it to Lhaminn as a gift. She said it was beautiful...
But there I am at a loss. Why are you returning this to me? Is something amiss?

dialogue.name: FLHAMINN
dialogue.text: No, Ascilia, nothing is amiss! Quite the opposite! I need you to realize how far you've come, and how much further you may still─must still go.

dialogue.name: FLHAMINN
dialogue.text: You and your allies have accomplished more than I could ever have hoped. You have succeeded where I failed, and made me so proud that...that words fail me.

dialogue.name: FLHAMINN
dialogue.text: But even as I marvel at the woman you've become, and at all the many things you've done, I cannot help but think of that which you have yet to do, and of what it may entail. Ascilia...Daughter─you cannot stay here anymore. You and the Scions must leave Ul'dah.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Lhaminn...

dialogue.name: FLHAMINN
dialogue.text: You built it once, Ascilia. You can build it again. And this time, we'll do it together.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Truly?

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Alphinaud. The time has come for the Scions to leave Vesper Bay.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: We shall establish a new headquarters in Revenant's Toll, as you proposed.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Much work lies ahead of us. Inform our fellow Scions, and send word to the Students of Baldesion: preparations begin at once!

dialogue.name: POP
dialogue.text: Ripples in the water catch your eye...
